page.text: J. MICHAEL ECHEVARRIA
State Bar No. 110418
Email: jme4318@yahoo.com
HARVARD LAW SCHOOL, Cambridge, MA, 1980-1983, J.D. 1983;
Recipient, Harvard Law School scholarship; Member, Sociedad
Interamericana; Writer, Dicta magazine; Artist, drama society
UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA AT LOS ANGELES, Los Angeles,
CA, 1976-1980, B.A. 1980; Magna cum laude; Pi Gamma mu; Alpha
kappa delta; Highest Honors, Sociology department; Norton Simon
Foundation scholarship; Writer, Satyr (Daily Bruin supplement); Awarded
American Sociological Association fellowship (declined); Awarded
Chancellor’s Intern fellowship (declined)
THOMAS & THOMAS LLP (formerly Thomas, Walton & Graves;
Thomas & Walton), Los Angeles, CA, 2001- 2013; Attorney, civil
litigation; Specializing in business litigation, including real estate,
contracts, municipal liability, probate, partnerships
WALTER, FINESTONE & RICHTER, Los Angeles, CA, 1998-2001;
Attorney, civil litigation; Specializing in business litigation, including
contracts, unfair competition, probate, dealership disputes, insurance,
partnerships
GAUNTLETT & ASSOCIATES, Irvine, CA, 1997; Attorney, civil
litigation; Specializing in insurance coverage, including intellectual
property, attorney malpractice
LAW OFFICES OF JOSEPH BROWN, Tarzana, CA, 1996; Trial
attorney for specific patent litigation; Planned, analyzed issues for trial,
receiving $3.1 million judgment on cross-complaint, including $2 million
in punitive damages in bench trial
SOUTHWESTERN UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF LAW, Los Angeles,
CA 1991-1996; Associate Professor of Law, 1991-1995; Full Professor of
Law, 1996; Subjects taught: contracts, remedies, civil rights and civil
liberties; Committees: Admissions (Chairman, 1992-1994), Academic
Standards; Advisor, Hispanic Law Students Association; Teacher of the
Year (Evening Class 1993-1994); Voted Commencement Grand Marshall
LAWLER, FELIX & HALL, Los Angeles, CA, 1983-1991; Attorney,
civil litigation; Specializing in business litigation, including banking law
(representing the FSLIC and FDIC), contracts, unfair competition,
antitrust, director and officer liability, fraud, employment, trademark;
Chairman, Appellate Advocacy Group; Reported decisions, Chevron v.
Bragg; T.M. Hylwa v. Palka; Bartram v. FDIC; FSLIC v. Molinaro (2
opinions)

text.i: A Precedent Embalms a Principle: The Expansion of the D’Oench Duhme

page.text: Doctrine, 43 Catholic University Law Review 746 (1994); 2B or Not 2B,
The Law Teacher 3 (Spring 1995); The Ploys of Summer: Antitrust,

text.i: Industrial Distrust, and the Case Against the Salary Cap for Major

page.text: League Baseball, 22 Florida State Law Review 827 (1995) (with Professor
Cameron); Reflections on O.J. and the Gas Chamber, 32 San Diego Law
Review 492 (1995)
Member, State Bar of California, 1983 to present; Admitted to practice,
United States District Court, 1984; United States Court of Appeal (Ninth
Circuit), 1987; Member, Law School Admissions Council (Finance and
Legal Affairs Committee), 1993-1995; Consultant, Legal Research
Network, 1995; Contracts lecturer, Barbri Bar Review, 1995; Testified
before the United States Senate (Government Oversight Committee),
January 31, 1995, reported in S.HRG 194-37, 21-25, 97-115
Born August 13, 1957, New York City (Manhattan), New York; Father of
two sons (Luis and Alec); Hobbies include drawing, painting, electric bass
guitar, making amateur video movies, creative writing; References
available upon request
